r2dii.climate.stress.test 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Sensitivity analysis: run_stress_test() multiple times

rerun_st.Rd

This function performs the so called "sensitivity analysis". It runs run_stress_test() multiple times, iterating over multiple values of one and only one argument of run_stress_test().

rerun_st(data, asset_type, ..., quiet = TRUE)

Arguments

data

Character vector of length 2. Paths to the directories ST_INPUTS_MASTER and ST_TESTING_{aset-type}, e.g. ST_TESTING_BONDS, respectively. These directories must have the files expected by the stress-test project.
asset_type

An atomic character vector. Either "bonds", "equity", or "loans".
...

Arguments passed to run_stress_test().
quiet

Logical. Print non-condiiton messages to the console?

Value

A data frame.

See also

Other main functions: run_stress_test()

Examples

library(dplyr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(readr, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(tidyr)

(data <- st_data_paths())

#>                          ST_DATA_PATH                     ST_PROJECT_FOLDER 
#> "/home/mauro/tmp/st/ST_INPUTS_MASTER" "/home/mauro/tmp/st/ST_TESTING_BONDS" 
compact <- suppressWarnings(rerun_st(data, "bonds", term = c(1, 2, 3)))

# A compact view of all your results
compact

#> # A tibble: 15 × 5
#>    st_type st_name                   arg_name arg_value st_result               
#>    <chr>   <chr>                     <chr>    <chr>     <list>                  
#>  1 bonds   comp                      term     1         <spec_tbl_df [533 × 30]>
#>  2 bonds   comp_el                   term     1         <spec_tbl_df [157 × 24]>
#>  3 bonds   port                      term     1         <spec_tbl_df [12 × 22]> 
#>  4 bonds   sector_pd_changes_annual  term     1         <spec_tbl_df [44 × 7]>  
#>  5 bonds   sector_pd_changes_overall term     1         <spec_tbl_df [20 × 7]>  
#>  6 bonds   comp                      term     2         <spec_tbl_df [533 × 30]>
#>  7 bonds   comp_el                   term     2         <spec_tbl_df [157 × 24]>
#>  8 bonds   port                      term     2         <spec_tbl_df [12 × 22]> 
#>  9 bonds   sector_pd_changes_annual  term     2         <spec_tbl_df [44 × 7]>  
#> 10 bonds   sector_pd_changes_overall term     2         <spec_tbl_df [20 × 7]>  
#> 11 bonds   comp                      term     3         <spec_tbl_df [533 × 30]>
#> 12 bonds   comp_el                   term     3         <spec_tbl_df [157 × 24]>
#> 13 bonds   port                      term     3         <spec_tbl_df [12 × 22]> 
#> 14 bonds   sector_pd_changes_annual  term     3         <spec_tbl_df [44 × 7]>  
#> 15 bonds   sector_pd_changes_overall term     3         <spec_tbl_df [20 × 7]>  

# The full view of all your results
full <- unnest(compact, st_result)

#> Warning: One or more parsing issues, see `problems()` for details
#> Warning: One or more parsing issues, see `problems()` for details

# You may save the result
path <- tempfile()
write_csv(full, file = path)
# and eventually re-read it
read_csv(path, show_col_types = FALSE)
